content:
Diagnosis:
Endometrial cancer - Grade 1 endometrioid adenocarcinoma, FIGO stage IA
PTEN mutation positive, microsatellite stable

Previous treatment:
Total laparoscopic hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy March 2024
Vault brachytherapy completed April 2024

Current medications:
Levothyroxine 100mcg daily

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
First follow-up post completion of treatment

I reviewed [redacted name] today for her first follow-up appointment following completion of vault brachytherapy. She has recovered well from her surgery and radiotherapy with no ongoing side effects. Her energy levels have improved significantly and she has returned to her usual activities. She denies any vaginal bleeding, discharge, or pelvic pain. Her appetite is good and weight stable.

On examination today, her abdomen is soft and non-tender with well-healed port sites. Vaginal examination shows good vault healing with no concerning features.

I have explained that her prognosis is excellent given the early stage and favorable histology. We will arrange CT chest/abdomen/pelvis for her 6-month follow-up visit as per protocol. She understands to contact us sooner if she develops any new symptoms in the interim.

cancer_timeline.value: Total laparoscopic hysterectomy and bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

patient_facts.value: Abdomen soft and non-tender with well-healed port sites
Vaginal examination shows good vault healing with no concerning features

status_updates.value: Early stage endometrial cancer treated with surgery and brachytherapy. Excellent recovery with no current concerns at first follow-up.
Good recovery from surgery and radiotherapy with no ongoing side effects
Energy levels improved significantly and returned to usual activities
